name: 08-Gen-AI-Report-NoPySpark
parameters: --var getStarted=true --var selectStore='Poultry' --var selectItem='Whole Chicken','Chicken Breast','Chicken Wings' --var execute=false --var trainingStore='Poultry','Egg' --var trainingItem='Whole Chicken','Cage-Free Eggs','Chicken Breast','Chicken Wings','Free-Range Eggs','Organic Eggs' --var modelSelection=1 --var trainModel1=false --var destinationPath=/home/sparkflows/fire-data/data/Poultry_Demand_Forecasting/Uploaded-File/ --var runModelValidaion=false --var getPrediction=true --var getPredictiveAnalysis=true

nodes.name: Read CSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Infer the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

nodes.name: Multi LLM Query
nodes.description: The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: llmConnection
fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: Select Connection

fields.name: temperature
fields.title: Temperature
fields.description: Temperature setting for the model (default: 0).

fields.name: contentCol
fields.title: Content Column
fields.description: Column name for the text content.

fields.name: imageCol
fields.title: Image Column
fields.description: Column name for the base 64 image.

fields.name: inputMode
fields.title: Mode Selection
fields.description: Select the model to use (text, image, text+image).

fields.name: task
fields.title: Select Prompt
fields.description: Specify the task to perform: summary, translation, topic extraction, or other.

optionsMap.summary: Generate a concise, multi-level bullet-point summary capturing key facts, insights, and implications from the content. Preserve structure and section hierarchy.
optionsMap.translation: Translate the content into fluent, formal English while preserving tone, context, cultural nuances, and domain-specific terminology (e.g., legal, medical, technical).
optionsMap.topic_extraction: Identify and extract key topics, subtopics, and entities. Categorize them with tags (e.g., Person, Location, Concept) and provide brief descriptions or summaries of each.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
Format this paragraph as follows: Example Response Template:

Poultry - Chicken Breast

                                                                                                                                       
MonthActualsPredictedForecast Trend
2016-07-313,285,9393,256,215Slightly Down
2016-08-312,417,0222,328,403Down
2016-09-303,145,4062,963,435Up
2016-10-313,630,6423,414,500Up
2016-11-303,420,4503,193,320Down
2016-12-313,430,9603,457,886Slightly Up

Analysis

       
  • Forecast Direction: Overall forecast shows a fluctuating trend with both upward and downward movements.
    •    
  • Seasonality: Slight seasonality observed with peaks around October to December.
    •    
  • Highest/Lowest Trend: Highest trend in October; lowest in August.
    •    
  • Specific High-Demand Month: October is a peak month with over 3.6M units in actual demand.
The analysis should be tuned and based on the table of data. Use for ** bold.
